title: Merge pull request #111 from jonzolla/background_download
message:
Merge pull request #111 from jonzolla/background_download

Add support for periodically downloading puzzles in the background.

title: Add support for periodically downloading puzzles in the background.
message:
Add support for periodically downloading puzzles in the background.

This is implemented by using JobScheduler to periodically download
puzzles that the user has selected. JobScheduler is only available
on API version >=21, so  this functionality is disabled for lower
API versions.

Using the JobScheduler API allows us to easily
provide options for downloading on wifi only, when charging, etc.

Currently just attempt to download every hour. There are more
intelligent things we can do here, but this has been working well
on my device.

The updated NYT authentication mechanism is supported by posting a
notification requesting login when a background download fails
instead of immediately launching the login activity.

A slight refactor of Downloaders was required to allow for
downloading the most recent the most recent puzzle for each source
instead of just the puzzle for the current (or specified) date.

title: Add a "Reveal" mode for "Errors".
message:
Add a "Reveal" mode for "Errors".

If "Show Errors" is enabled, this fills in the correct anwswer in all "red" boxes.

If "Show Errors" is disabled, this fills in the correct answer in any currently incorrect boxes, and marks those boxes "red".

This also refactors checking for "blank" squares into a helper method.

title: Fix a crash when attempting to open old Newsday puzzles.
message:
Fix a crash when attempting to open old Newsday puzzles.

BrainsOnly is returning valid but empty crossword files, which
eventually causes an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when dealing
with zero-element grids. Reject these at parse time and add a test.

checks.  This change moves those to methods an gives them a clean,
readable name.

title: Merge pull request #3 from rappazzo/next-parallel-movement-strategy
message:
Merge pull request #3 from rappazzo/next-parallel-movement-strategy

movement-strategy: alter the 'next parallel clue' algorithm

title: movement-strategy: alter the 'next parallel clue' algorithm
message:
movement-strategy: alter the 'next parallel clue' algorithm

This new algorithm determines which next parallel word shares the most
adjacent fillable boxes with the current word, and uses that word.  In
the case where multiple parallel words share the same amount of adjacent
boxes, then the word closest to the start of the current word will be
used.
